feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 3 - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: The system struggles with accurate leap year day inclusion in service duration and gratuity calculations.
findings.issue_explanation: Multiple tickets revealed inconsistent handling of February 29th and total service days calculation during leap years.
findings.limitation_statement: Current calculation logic does not automatically and consistently account for 366 days in leap years.

findings.group_description: Inconsistent and complex daily wage calculation methods across different payroll scenarios.
findings.issue_explanation: Different modules (leave policy, salary proration, gratuity) use varying divisors and calculation methods for daily wage.
findings.limitation_statement: No standardized, configurable daily wage calculation method across system modules.

findings.group_description: Unpredictable and potentially incorrect unpaid leave deduction calculations.
findings.issue_explanation: Global configuration overrides policy-level settings, causing unexpected deduction amounts.
findings.limitation_statement: System lacks transparent hierarchy for leave deduction calculation methods.

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually verify service duration calculations during leap years.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Confirm total days include February 29th when applicable. Manually cross-check system calculation against manual calculation.

troubleshooting.group_description: Ensure consistent daily wage configuration across modules.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify daily wage divisor in leave policy, salary proration, and gratuity calculations. Configure consistent divisor (30, 30.42, or working days) across all modules.

troubleshooting.group_description: Check global vs policy-level unpaid leave deduction settings.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global daily rate configuration. Confirm it aligns with policy-specific calculation requirements. Manually adjust deductions if global settings cause incorrect calculations.

glossary.definition: The number of days used to calculate an employee's daily wage rate, which can vary between 30, 30.42, or working days depending on system configuration.
Days considered for salary calculation, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on the employee's work week configuration.
